title: Citi Offers Treasury Skills Training for Dominican Republic Clients
summary: Santo Domingo - On April 18-20, Citibank Dominican Republic clients who work in areas such as finance, treasury, banking, risk management and foreign exchange took part in the "Bourse Game," a financial skills training seminar at the Santo Domingo Hilton.
tag-1: Citi Offers Treasury Skills Training for Dominican Republic Clients
tag-3: Santo Domingo – On April 18-20, Citibank Dominican Republic clients who work in areas such as finance, treasury, banking, risk management and foreign exchange took part in the "Bourse Game," a financial skills training seminar at the Santo Domingo Hilton.
tag-4: The three-day seminar allowed participants to play the role of financial manager/treasurer. It featured simulated computer transactions via an electronic broker, offering an opportunity to gain practical knowledge of foreign exchange and money markets. Some of the specific skills emphasized included how to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of different financial instruments; understanding buy/sell and loan rates and how they operate; calculating spot, cross, swap and future prices; distributing assets and liabilities in response to shifting interest rates and liquidity; managing cash flow and foreign currency reserve positions; and adopting more flexible decision-making strategies.
tag-5: Janet Wilson, former director of Citibank's North American Investment Bank Training Center and Global Institute of Finance, and Edgardo Chin, founder and president of Logos Consulting Services – a company that provides software development consulting and training simulations for banks, multinational companies and universities – led the seminar.
tag-6: "This event was organized in response to the growing demand for specialized programs offering practical and appropriate tools for carrying out a range of value-added activities for businesses in this area," explained Javier Guerrero, Citi Dominican Republic Director and Country Treasurer, who delivered the seminar's closing comments. "It is another example of Citi's commitment to its clients and to strengthening Dominican society."
